content: RSS Discussions Moz News By: Rand Fishkin August 1, 2005 The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. Table of Contents Copied! By: Rand Fishkin August 1, 2005 RSS Discussions Moz News The author's views are entirely their own (excluding the unlikely event of hypnosis) and may not always reflect the views of Moz. An excellent thread at SEOChat points out the defintion of RSS (Really Simple Syndication) and how it's use in websites for SEO purposes can help to boost things like pages indexed, fresh content, and the "long tail" of search visitors. In particular, several resources were pointed to: How to Make Your Own RSS Feed with PHP An Automatic RSS Generation Tool An Overview of RSS In addition to SEOChat, Cre8asite also has a good RSS thread going - this one eventually focuses on the true value of updated content, and Ammon Johns points out that fresh content doesn't just give a boost for being fresh, it also generates more links, more content and thus, more chances to be found in the SERPs. Copied! Back to Top
